word: There are men holding responsible positions, and many think that they would prove traitors to the cause and work of God, should they intimate that these men were in the wrong. But the Lord has a controversy with these men who have followed the natural tendency of their own minds, and have been led by their own selfish impulses passing for zeal for the Lord. The way in which they have dealt with Frank Belden's case, will not afford them any pleasure when they have to face the record on the books of heaven in the great day of God, and stand before him who says, "I know thy works." The time is coming when there will be an investigation of the characters of the living and the dead.
